title: Problem in installing latest version
body_html:
• PyTorch
  • OS: Ubuntu 16.04
  • PyTorch version: -
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): conda
  • Python version: 3.6
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.0/7 as well as 8.0/6
  • GPU models and configuration: -
  • GCC version (if compiling from source): -
  • CMake version: -
  • Build command you used (if compiling from source): -
  • Versions of any other relevant libraries:

Hi,
when I try to install pytorch by the following command, an old version is installed.

conda install pytorch torchvision cuda90 -c pytorch

$ conda install pytorch torchvision cuda90 -c pytorch
Using Anaconda Cloud api site https://api.anaconda.org
Fetching package metadata .........
Solving package specifications: ..........

Package plan for installation in environment /opt/anaconda3/envs/cntk-py36:

The following packages will be downloaded:

    package                    |            build
    ---------------------------|-----------------
    numpy-1.11.3               |           py36_0         6.7 MB
    scipy-0.19.0               |      np111py36_0        35.9 MB
    scikit-learn-0.18.1        |      np111py36_1        11.1 MB
    ------------------------------------------------------------
	                                   Total:        53.7 MB

The following NEW packages will be INSTALLED:

    cffi:         1.10.0-py36_0                        (soft-link)
    cuda90:       1.0-h6433d27_0               pytorch (soft-link)
    cudatoolkit:  8.0-3                                (soft-link)
    cudnn:        6.0.21-cuda8.0_0                     (soft-link)
    libgcc:       5.2.0-0                              (soft-link)
    nccl:         1.3.4-cuda8.0_1                      (soft-link)
    pycparser:    2.18-py36_0                          (soft-link)
    pytorch:      0.1.12-py36cuda8.0cudnn6.0_1         (soft-link)
    torchvision:  0.1.8-py36_0                         (soft-link)

The following packages will be UPDATED:

    mkl:          11.3.3-0                             --> 2017.0.3-0         (soft-link)
    numpy:        1.11.2-py36_0                        --> 1.11.3-py36_0      (soft-link)
    scikit-learn: 0.18.1-np111py36_0                   --> 0.18.1-np111py36_1 (soft-link)
    scipy:        0.18.1-np111py36_0                   --> 0.19.0-np111py36_0 (soft-link)

How should I install the latest version?
Thanks.

- PyTorch 
- OS: Ubuntu 16.04

- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): conda
- Python version: 3.6

- GPU models and configuration: -
- GCC version (if compiling from source): -
- CMake version: -
- Build command you used (if compiling from source): -
- Versions of any other relevant libraries:

Hi, 
when I try to install pytorch by the following command, an old version is installed.

`conda install pytorch torchvision cuda90 -c pytorch`

	$ conda install pytorch torchvision cuda90 -c pytorch
	Using Anaconda Cloud api site https://api.anaconda.org
	Fetching package metadata .........
	Solving package specifications: ..........

	Package plan for installation in environment /opt/anaconda3/envs/cntk-py36:

	The following packages will be downloaded:

	    package                    |            build
	    ---------------------------|-----------------
	    numpy-1.11.3               |           py36_0         6.7 MB
	    scipy-0.19.0               |      np111py36_0        35.9 MB
	    scikit-learn-0.18.1        |      np111py36_1        11.1 MB
	    ------------------------------------------------------------
		                                   Total:        53.7 MB

	The following NEW packages will be INSTALLED:

	    cffi:         1.10.0-py36_0                        (soft-link)
	    cuda90:       1.0-h6433d27_0               pytorch (soft-link)
	    cudatoolkit:  8.0-3                                (soft-link)
	    cudnn:        6.0.21-cuda8.0_0                     (soft-link)

	    scipy:        0.18.1-np111py36_0                   --> 0.19.0-np111py36_0 (soft-link)

How should I install the latest version?
Thanks.
